Reviews.Title: “Great, central spot”
Reviews.Author: zzao
Reviews.Content: For £70 a night this is a really good find for 5 mins from Kings Cross station. The room was not huge, but not problem small, everything was clean and a few small pack of biscuits is always appreciated. No complaints and the best of several hotels I have tried in this area.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the lads”
Reviews.Author: FLexington_12
Reviews.Content: Myself and a few of the boys stayed here, we were expecting something from the film Hostel but were pretty surprised. It wasn’t the Taj Mahal but no one was expecting that. Place was clean enough, had a nice kettle, few bickies, towels and stuff were changed even though we were only there for two nights. Hardly a place to bring the wife and kids but if you are just a bunch of lads you’ll have no problems. Staff were all good bant as well and seemed pretty down to earth and friendly, sure there was no bloke In a top hat to take your bags, but again, I wasn’t expecting that for the price. Would totes stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Worst Ever!”
Reviews.Author: OK_NY2011
Reviews.Content: So we booked this "hotel" without really looking into more details and trusting their website pictures... What a mistake! We arrived late and when we came to our room we did not know what to do - everything, from smell to the sheets was so disgusting! After checking the sheets closely we found spots of blood on them! It seemed like the room was not cleaned since the building was built. The management said they did not have any other rooms available, which at the end of the day we did not even want any! In the middle of the night we started looking for another hotel as we could not stay a single minute in this kind of place. Thankfully, there was another bed & breakfast style hotel a few houses down, which was less expensive and clean! We requested our money to be refunded, but the management refused and returned only the partial payment. That's how they probably make their money - by tricking tourists with their "beautiful" room pictures on the website and not returning the money. We later read other reviews and people had to find another place to sleep as well. It really is a scam and I hope people will think twice before booking it. If there was an option to give a negative rating, we definitely would!

Reviews.Title: “Just about satisfactory for the price”
Reviews.Author: HarryAngstrom1
Reviews.Content: Clean, basic rooms for close to budget price. Location a little further from Kings ross than other budget hotels in the area. Breakfast was very basic, only cold croissant and some toasts but the coffee was excellent. If it was £20 cheaper it would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe my standards are wrong but...”
Reviews.Author: Sean m
Reviews.Content: This place looks great value but actually isn't. I'd have been better off spending a few more pounds so I didn't feel depressed and claustrophobic in this very poor room... never ever ever again will I believe laterooms.com

Reviews.Title: “Misleading pictures on website listings”
Reviews.Author: 17Frequent_Traveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked like decent value at Â£64 per night for a single room and breakfast. The pictures posted on Hotels-London.co.uk gave the impression that the rooms were clean and moderately modern. However, when I got to my single room, it looked like a prison cell, furnished with second-hand very basic, not even shabby-chic furniture. It was very depressing. The wooden toilet seat was all worn and fraying at the inside front, and harbored goodness knows what kind of bacteria. Although the shower was clean, the very small en-suite smelt nasty. The bed was lumpy, athough the sheets were clean.The carpet in the room, and throughout the hotel, was filthy. The road noise was noticeable, and the walls were so thin I could hear the man next door snoring. The only positive was that the breakfast, although basic, was ample for me. A croissant, a choice of brown or white toast, cereal, and fruit juices, and tea and coffee. I wont be staying at Swinton again, and can't recommend it. I was embarrassed to think that foreign visitors have to stay in places like this in London for this price.

Reviews.Title: “NOT BAD”
Reviews.Author: KEWBOB
Reviews.Content: Went with open mind after reading previous reviews but it was a short walk from Kings Cross, we got there earlier than checking in time and got into our room, the room was in basment with very large window and three beds, basic I agree but more than ample room, the bathroom/shower was small but adequate. Breakfast was excellant, it states continental and that is what is was, the service was quick and the staff were all very friendly. We could even leave our bags so we didn't have to carry them all over London. I will say this to all you people who have rated this low, you got what you paid for in London if you expected better you should have paid what the other hotels were asking.

Reviews.Title: “Great location , disappointing room.”
Reviews.Author: BettyStoggs
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap by London standards at Â£84 per night but if you are using Kings Cross or St Pancras it is a perfect location. On the positive side the sheets and towels were clean and there was copious hot water. The washing facilities were all clean and the shower worked perfectly . Being on the second floor at the rear the room was very quiet. On the down side the room was tiny, the carpet was old and stained and the furniture was 70 s pine , old and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happily Surprised”
Reviews.Author: kbabe31
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews with some trepidation, but for 80 quid for a London hotel with breakfast, we thought not bad. How right we were. We were welcomed at the door with a very good security system, politely checked in and given the key to our room. The lift is a bit bijou but it got us to the top floor in one piece. The room was small but clean and tidy with plenty of tea, coffee and biscs and clean towels and bathroom condiments. The only problem was the windows didnt stay open so we had to prop it up with the bin! Breakfast the next morning was lovely, the very pleasant waitress had a bit of a job grasping there;s no glasses left but we got there in the end! We had tea, coffee, juice, lovely flaky croissants, cheese, beautiful sliced ham and toast with a choice of jam, honey, marmalade and even chocolate spread and marmite to choose from. All in all we were very impressed and would certainly book there again and recommend it to friends. Tube wise, about the same distance from Angel and Kings cross, about a 10 minute walk, but Kings Cross is the flatter route

Reviews.Title: “Tired, dated, cheap fittings not to be recommended”
Reviews.Author: Huxham
Reviews.Content: Filthy, expensive dump with decor dating from the 70's. Many fixtures broken, cracked, rusty or just not working. Â£84 for one person for one night is a complete rip-off for this standard of hotel even in London. Big-name budget hotels nearby much better value for money. Only positive I that the bedding and towels were clean and freshly changed.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in quiet room !!!!!! like hell”
Reviews.Author: terrys57
Reviews.Content: Well I have stayed at a lot of Kings Cross Hotels in the last 2 years. this by far is the noisest hotel I have ever stayed at 24/7 major short cut for heavy trucks buses,lorries and noisy cars.!!!!! all day and all night. Poor breaky, no bake beans no eggs, nothing cooked at all. ceral and bread and tea and coffee. I asked for a double bed in a quiet room and was prepared to pay extra on arrival I got a room at the front upstairs. despite double windows the noise was unbearable.!!!! be warned. The room was clean, but no fresh air till you opened the window!!!! and the noise was so load I couldnt hear the tv !!!!!!. friendly staff, dont ask for an Iron it had melted plastic stuck on it. and was unuseable!!! definetly not recomended except for those who get a room at the back and stay for one night only . bewarned as all London hotels the photos are tricky.! aussie living n europe.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Swinton Hotel accountable to no one!”
Reviews.Author: gmarshall_140
Reviews.Content: I booked a London hotel on behalf of my wife through www.booking.com. My wife and son reported to the hotel very late on Friday 1st April. The concierge requested payment before showing the accommodation. My wife was appalled when viewing the room because of faecal and urine smell and sought a change of room. In the the second room the toilet leaked, there was insufficient room to open door without knocking into bed. Air conditioning was a fan, there were stains on ceilings, the pipes in both ensuite rooms were open (not boxed in) and pipes were not clean, ensuite facilities in both roomswere not full size sink units- just cloakroom size sink units. I have written to the manager of Swinton Hotel who has not replied. Gerard Marshall Dervaig Silvertonhill Lnae Dumbarton G82 2LJ 01389 765178

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: amy12ty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we had a night out in London and live far away. The location is fanastic and the overall hotel was clean. The rooms are very budget and the hallways are small but you get what you pay for! It's not the worst hotel in the world and for a stop over for a night out it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “'Psycho' meets 'The Shining' with a bit of 'Hostel' thrown in”
Reviews.Author: pint_size_princess
Reviews.Content: As a female travelling alone, I never once felt safe in this hotel. I'm not usually a wimp, but the room I was given was the furthest away from Reception, down a long, winding corridor. The door to my room didn't lock and could easily have been pushed open from the outside, meaning I was constantly on edge the whole time. While the guy on Reception was friendly enough, I didn't see or hear another soul the whole time I was there, making me sure that I was the only person staying in the whole place and I agree with the other reviewer who said it felt as though they were being watched constantly... Too scared to close my eyes so ended up calling a friend to pick me up at 1am and spent the night on their sofa!! Don't know what I would have done if I didn't know someone in the city. I definitely wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, especially if you're travelling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay if your a lone female traveller!!!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaPatCornwall
Reviews.Content: Im afraid this place really gave me the creeps! The walk from Kings cross is intimidating at night. I dont scare easily but slept with my clothes on in case of being disturbed or there being a fire. There was no way of locking the door from inside my room and my room was directly opposite the lift on the first floor. i didnt see any other females at all, staff or guests. My room wasnt too bad considering the rest of the hotel but the curtains were dirty and wouldnt pull together! Felt like I was being watched! The sheets were clean as were the towels. So glad when it was morning and I left without experiencing the breakfast. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: dingo5352
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with clients. On arrival after a short flight, I needed a shower. There was NO hot water and after complaining, I was told they would fix it in the morning so no shower was had. The rooms are very small with very basic features.The ensuite was so small that when you needed to sit on the toilet, the wash basin was in your face. I had to lean to one side to avoid hitting my head off the basin. The beds were fine albeit a little short on pillows but if you are looking for a good nights sleep, this is not for you. The street noise is horrendous. It must be the busiest road in London 24hrs a day. The room was very warm and I had to balance the need to open the window against the level of noise. I decided to purchase earplugs and they did the trick. In my opinion, there are better hotels out there for less. The hotel is approx 10-15mins from the Kings Cross tube station. Shop around....

Reviews.Title: “Swinton Hotel "Value for Money"”
Reviews.Author: aravind2981
Reviews.Content: Location: The Hotel is in prime location in london. The hotel is at the walkable distance from "London - Tube railway station" (King cross pancreas). So people who are preferring for sight seeing the hotel is a good place to stay. Interior: I stayed in a single bedroom. The rooms are neat and tidy. I found myself very comfortable over there Facilities & benefit: The Hotel has free Wireless internet service. I chat with my family in India. They also provide free complimentary break fast. The break fast is very good with varieties of Fruit juices available. Economy: The room rent is very economical. i paid only 59 pounds/day. This is one of the cheapest & finest hotel you can find in london. Conclusion: I recommend others to stay in this hotel. It is in prime location & walkable distance to London Tube railway system. Cheapest & finest hotel in London.

Reviews.Title: “Probably not a great idea”
Reviews.Author: blackdahlia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel having read the reviews on here, so I had a fairly good idea of what awaited me - but I had to be in London at short notice, and money is tight at the moment! The hotel did not inspire confidence from the word go, since the building next door is in an advanced state of decay. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and the hotel is a short walk from Kings cross station - the drawback is that the area is not exactly safe at night, especially for a woman on her own, so I resorted to a taxi once it got dark. My room was grubby to say the least - a shower that looked as though you could catch Legionnaire's just by looking at it, rotting wood on the bathroom door frame and enough dust to fill a large cushion. Oddly enough, my bed was spotlessly clean and very comfy! The TV didn't work, but since I was out all evening I didn't bother complaining - and given the seedy location and the fact that you had to leave your room key at reception when you went out, I took my laptop and mp3 player with me. If you just need a place to put your head down after an evening out, I suppose it would do for the price - but next time I'm in London I'll be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unkempt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tracy782010
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed in this hotel for one night, and one night was enough. The room was tiny and the carpet and curtains were filthy. The bathroom was small and the towel rail was all rusty and the towels they provided had stains all over them. The bed was really uncomfortable. The room where breakfast was provided was really small, and all the guests were sqaushed in there almost sitting on top of each other!! I would not want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG only for the brave”
Reviews.Author: TBF28
Reviews.Content: I booked very late thru Laterooms.com and quickly looked at the website for this hotel. It looked OK. Be warned this place is a cheap and nasty dump. The pictures on the website are very misleading and I have reported to Laterooms.com. This place was very seedy and for a woman travelling on her own it was scary and I am not easily intimidated. When I showed friends pictures of this hotel (which are almost identical to the ones already on this page!), they could not believe it and as pals do, kindly suggested I could have supplimented my income fror the night. Thats what it feels like - a knocking shop with pay per hour rooms!! Avoid at all costs - pay the extra Â£20 and stay at nearby Travelodge

Reviews.Title: “BRIGHT RED LIGHT”
Reviews.Author: Moll25
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the outside of the hotel looked nice, clean and tidy as it was bright, sun shining - an idyllic London day. Upon entry the reception area looked OK, friendly staff who directed us to the lift. 3 adults + luggage. Upon entry into the lift we noticed a ladder inside the lift. We questioned the receptionist about the purpose of the ladder and WHTEHER THE LADDER BELONGED IN THE LIFT, and WHY? The staff member apologised and removed the LADDER from the LIFT?!?! At that point we had 4 adults + luggage + ladder in a lift measuring 4x4, room to move was wishfull thinking. We were instructed to go to the second floor, where we were meant to be staying. Upon reaching the second floor we were greeted by a psychotic "staff member" screaming enquieries at us about his ladder. We had to explain to this clearly challenged gentlemen that we did not "nick" his ladder and were just wanting to be directed to our room. Our room was on the third floor despite the assurance of the reception staff we had to go to the second floor. The room can only be described as "disgusting" - please refer to the other reviews for more detailed description. The sheets were spotless which is a bonus, but goes very little of the way to any comfort at the thought what the mattres underneath would look like, and the organisms it could/does contain. Once we woke up in the hotel which chooses to inconspiquosly advertise its existence with a BRIGHT RED NEON light, the type you would see in a seedy 80's movie about a down and out policeman that falls in love with a lady of the night, our breakfast was served by the still psychotic "handyman" from the night before. Who we also caught fixing electrical plugs, sweeping the street outside, perform reception duties and wait for it, paint the rooms. So while "Van Gogh" of Swinton street was serving us breakfast in his paint stained clothes we were firm in our decision we will NEVER EVER STAY THERE again. And as a final point, the breakfast is not a breakfast BYO is strongly advised. You have been warned, stay away!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing, indifferent staff, good location”
Reviews.Author: KGLoki
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight after travelling to London for the football. Arrived early, staff allowed us to leave luggage. Returned to freshen up and informed reception no hot water and heating not working and informed they would sort it. Upon arriving back at hotel in early hours we were informed the hot water was off and that they had other rooms a different floor if we needed a shower (not good for the disabled treveller like myself). We were also informed that the boiler was not working in our wing of the hotel so there would be no heating. It was -2 outside and no extra blankets or covers were provided. The bathroom was no more than a closet, and someone my size, 6' 3" would struggle. The shower although unused we could tell would be a tight fit and when sat upon the toilet the knees were leant on the bathroom door, which had no lock and opened straight onto the facing bed. When we inquired in the morning about some kind of discount and to place a complaint we were informed we would have to see the manager, yet noone would get him or tell us who he was. The receptionist saturday afternoon was helpfull, saturday night and sunday they were uninterested in our situation. However, there was one upside, the breakfast was both tastefull and plentyfull with friendly, helpfull staff. The location for Kings X was also a plus, less than ten minutes for myself to walk even though i am on crutches. Able bodied could walk in five minuites easy. Overall not a pleasurable experience and one i will not be repeating again. I would rather pay the extra for elsewhere than visit this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: dereklangton
Reviews.Content: I stayed in The Swinton during the first week of February 2010. My room was pleasantly heated during this terribly freezing week and kept clean and tidy. Towels were changed fresh, the bed done and the garbage removed, all daily. The staff was always kind and helpful and willing to serve. The breakfast was good. The (double) room was somewhat tiny (as is so usual in London hotels), but the shower was quite alright, hot water ran plentifully all day. I liked my stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous - stay at your peril”
Reviews.Author: Traveller258
Reviews.Content: I arrived in London at 10:30pm and was extremely upset and disturbed to be faced with, by far the worst hotel I have ever set foot in. The reception area was filthy and when I walked up the stairs to the third floor the stench was overpowering and almost made me physically sick. The room itself was filthy, the 'bathroom' which conveniently isnâ€™t shown on their website was even worse. The grout on the tiles was mouldy and black, the toilet would never appear to have been cleaned, just had green bleach poured in over the visible filth at the bottom of the toilet bowl. As I was only in London for the one night I considered whether or not I could stay here, the whole room just look untidy, unkept and worst of all un-clean. It was genuinely worse than hostels I have stayed in, in Bangkok. I decided at this point that I could not stay here and was then faced with trying to find a hotel room in London a few weeks before Christmas which was not an easy task and ended up costing me over Â£200. When I checked out I explained my dissatisfaction and that I could not stay there and wanted a refund, at which point the man on reception told me the machine was broken, clearly I thought I would not see my money again but they did actually give me a refund a few days later.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - the worst carpet in London!”
Reviews.Author: Sybil_Ramkin
Reviews.Content: Booked in here by my company for its vicinity to our meeting. The outside looks OK even though the street was run down but once inside I had to resist running away. As four of us were booked in and paid for we felt obliged to stay The man on reception was pleasant but once we stepped out of the reception area into the neglected corridors it went down hill. The decor and carpets were dirty and stained - this continued into my room. I did not take of my shoes and socks to walk on the carpet as the carpet felt soggy. The bedlinen was clean and fresh otherwise I could not have stayed but the bath and in particular the shower curtain were disgusting - stained and rotting. I spent most of my time on the bed wondering how to get out of the room without standing on the carpet again I did not have a bedside table but a fridge........turned off and mouldy inside - I wish my curiosity had not made me open the door! There was no wardrobe but a contraption of a couple of poles and plastic hangers - better than putting my clothes on the soggy carpet I suppose There was a TV - attached very firmly to the wall to prevent theft but so high up I had to lie on the bed to look up at it Breakfast - now that was an interesting experience. Not so much a breakfast room as 8 tables crammed into the smallest space possible with a waitress and a toaster. Oh, and a trolley with cereal already poured out and old rolls. Did I mention the carpet?

Reviews.Title: “Fine.”
Reviews.Author: RKandBT
Reviews.Content: The best bit was the huge breakfast. The room and bathroom was very small, but clean. The only reason to stay here is to be close to King Cross.

Reviews.Title: “'Fleapit'”
Reviews.Author: EasytravellerUk
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have stayed in for a long time. There must be one room in the hotel that is clean and fresh - that is how they fool you with a nice photo and you see the odd decent review (or the owner has written it!). From the moment you leave the reception area, your heart sinks. The corridors are seriously tatty and look like they haven't been decorated in 40 years. The room was disgusting. I put down towels on the carpet as it looked so flea-ridden! Don't lift the bed cover up and look under the bed - your mind will be full of nightmares for years to come. The bed must have been 40 years old too! . I immediately tried to find another hotel but everything else was full so I stayed. Outside the noise from the main road and the local drunks was incessant all night. I slept on top of the bed with my clothes on and eventually got a few hours sleep. Reception staff were OK and towels/white sheets and bathroom were cleanish but that was about it. Room was tiny and bedside lamp had live wires visible. Internet didn't work in the room - only in reception. This hotel is the kind of place that gives London a bad name. With a little bit of effort, the owner could clean and decorate it and it would be half decent. But they haven't bothered in 40 years so not likely to do so now. Avoid at all costs...never again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - basic and clean”
Reviews.Author: electric_landlady
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with this hotel and would definitely use it again if I needed somewhere cheap and near Kings Cross. The room was spotlessly clean and seemed recently decorated, with tea/coffee and biscuits. There was also a hairdryer, electric fan and Sky TV which is more than I expect to get in this price bracket. The only things I would criticise were that the TV remote didn't work and the curtains didn't close properly, but these are very minor quibbles. The road the hotel is on is fairly noisy all night, but that's central London for you. The continental breaky was good too, far better than some I have had! Staff were polite, friendly and helpful and there is 24 hour reception. All in all a really good bet if you are on a budget and need somewhere central to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and Budget-Friendly Hotel... the real story!”
Reviews.Author: Binkey_Lux
Reviews.Content: Ok, I really don't know what people are expecting for the money.. be really honest, you're not going to get the Ritz for a double costing Â£59 a night in central London! The hotel itself is ideal for anyone with a strict budget who just needs a base to operate from. It's really close to Kings Cross/St Pancras station which is a blessing if you've got a long day of travel ahead of you. True the hotel itself does look grubby from the outside but they have tried their best to keep the inside looking presentable and clean. It's shockingly tricky to do this in high traffic central London! The staff were helpful and pleasant enough. They checked me in promptly and ordered me a taxi when I asked for one later without any attitude. No issues with me turning up after 2am from a night of clubbing either. If you want the fake, sugar-sweet, over friendly reception you get at some hotels, feel free to pay through the nose for this and stay elsewhere. The lift is a bit prehistoric but it works. My room was fair sized and was decorated to a basic but modern standard. It was freshly hoovered, had clean sheets on the bed and telly & kettle worked. No issues with noise despite my room being on the same side as a 'main' road and being in the room directly opposite the lift. Despite the horror stories there was no hint of flea infestations, I checked!! The bathroom was clean but probably could do with a slight tweak here and there, however I feel they made the most of the space they had - toilet, sink and shower all worked fine and I didn't have any issues regarding there being no hot water of a morning... granted you do have to let the shower run for a little while before it gets to optimum temperature. The bottom line is that I've stayed in more expensive hotels where the standard has been *lower* than here in every respect. Continental breakfast is served right up until 10am, which is good if you prefer to sleep in slightly later. I cannot comment on the standard or quality of the food because I was running super late and it was more important that I caught my train than staying around to find out what the food was like! If you want more than than a basic place to lay your head, simply pay for a more expensive hotel. I would not have paid Â£80 for a double here though - if you do then you're getting ripped off and WILL be let down by the hotel. If you book directly from the website its cheaper than booking through Laterooms etc. All in all not a bad stay and not as dire as people have made it out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Swinton Hotel or The London Dungeon”
Reviews.Author: Lennytrippin
Reviews.Content: My wife booked the hotel for itâ€™s convenient location to the wedding reception we were attending and when I previewed it on the internet before our trip to London it looked clean, cosy and quite basic. My first impressions were daunted when we entered Swinton Street itself which looked jaded, dirty and neglected. We reached the outside of the hotel and were not encouraged or heartened by the scrappy paintwork and dusty curtains and we reluctantly entered the building to find nothing short of a hovel. We refused use of the lift and accepted the challenge of 3 flights of stairs. We were less intimidated by the garish pattern of the carpet than we were of the stains it failed to hide. We were also very cautious not to touch the filthy paintwork, which took a degree of skill considering the amount of luggage we had. The room contained a bed which boasted a surprisingly clean set of sheets. Other than that we were again predictably disappointed. Everything just looked and felt grubby. Iâ€™m getting flashbacks as I type of the rust encrusted toilet roll holder, the curtains which had black filth along the rims and the shower that was too small to actually shower in. To be honest, we werenâ€™t expecting too much for our Â£80 - somewhere clean to change and to wash and to rest and to set us up with a hearty breakfast on our departure for our journey in the morning. The hotel failed to fulfil any of these requirements. When we awoke in the morning after an unsettled sleep â€“ partly due to the brawl outside at 4am and partly due to the distress of having just wasted Â£80 â€“ we were faced with the absurd situation of having no running water. Deprived of our basic morning ablutions we then braved the dining area for breakfast. By this time we had discarded hope and expected the worse. We were placed on a table next to what looked like an old washing mangle which was being used as a dumping area for the staffs bags and coats. The coffee was hot and the toast seemed fresh but that was really as far as we were prepared to push our luck. We evacuated the building as quickly as possible and... well... Iâ€™ve been having nightmares ever since.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: lucile24
Reviews.Content: This was the most dreadful hotel I have ever experienced it was like something out of a horror movie. Smelly dirty room overlooking a block of noisy council flats which I witnessed a robbery on the last night of our stay. My friend and I felt very unsafe heard lots of strange noises and the gap under the door is so big anyone in the corrider could look in. Everything in the bathroom was rusty and the shower was so tiny. We left our window open the whole duration of the stay to try let the disgusting mouldy smell out. Breakfast was disgusting, a bit of toast and cereal served by waitresses who could not speak english.When checking out I used the toilet beside the reception, disgusting. The mans clothes from reception were rolled up in balls in the corners and there were dirty socks lying on the floor. DO NOT STAY HERE, its like the motel from Psycho run by norman bates although much dirtier.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one”
Reviews.Author: Kakumei-kun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in this hotel, which looked convenient regarding its close location to St Pancras' Eurostar station. That was the good side of our stay in the swinton hotel. We payed 70 pounds for a double bed room, shower and WC included. We were given a room on the street side, with a thin glass window that wouln't close at all.. considering the street is actually a road, we were counting cars that couldn't stop passing and passing a few meters from us. the worst thing being the ventilation van : once you switch on the light in the bathroom, the ventilation starts working automatically, and stops only a couple of minutes after you've switched off the light. Our neighbour must have forgotten to switch off his light, therefore we couldn't sleep before 2 or 3 in the night (indeed it's not easy to get some rest with thin walls and a Boeing 747 reactor right behing them...) finally the breakfast was a joke so I won't comment it more than needed. on the following day we found another hotel, cheaper and much better! It was even closer to St Pancras.

Reviews.Title: “fleas flourished dodt go there”
Reviews.Author: jgd754
Reviews.Content: moved to this hotel from one accross the road when we got back at 2315. (still dont know why as the rest of our party were not moved.) Room was filthy, carpet badly stained, tea and coffee but no milk and the cups were still dirty from the previous guests, no shaving socket so hubby had to travel home without shaving. The sink was blocked up with hair, so water took ages to drain. Couldn't get into bed as sheets were definitely not fresh, so slept on top with coat covering. The room was nothing like there website. Came home with multiple flea bites, so at least one living creature likes the rooms..

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night, but scare stories are not far off!!!”
Reviews.Author: wanderer_scotland
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife were only in London for one night, and were looking for a cheap hotel round Kings Cross that was nothing special, just a place that we could get some rest for the one night we were in London! We booked into the Hotel Swinton as it was only Â£70 for a double room, and was in the area we were wanting. The website of this hotel is very missleading, as it made it look very stylish and clean, but to be honest it is far from that! It is far from the worse hotel I have ever stayed in, and I am pretty open minded to some of teh stuff I read on here, but given the choice I would probably stay somewhere else next time! Good points about the hotel are location (short walk to Kings Cross) and the breakfast was really good, but there are more bad points! The actual rooms themselves are not to bad, but our room was burning as there was a heater we could not turn off, which lead to an uncomfertable sleep at night! The real problem was the bathroom, which had a strong smell of [--] and the lack of a chair in the bedroom (my wife had to put her make up on sitting on the bed with her pocket mirror). Anyone in London for one night and on a budget then this hotel does the job, but no chance I will stay in it again!

Reviews.Title: “Hell hole: Don't stay”
Reviews.Author: yseigkp
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time here for the following reasons: 1) prostitutes and dodgy people walking around the hotel 2) scary and rude staff at the check-in counter 3) the room is literally hell, so dirty 4) the toilet is so dirty and the floor is caving in, 5) there is no a/c, 6) the bed is full of bugs, that i got bitten do i need to go on?

Reviews.Title: “Dire, Filthy Hovel!!!! Do Not Go!!!”
Reviews.Author: duff_sarah71
Reviews.Content: If you value your safety, and cleanliness, under no circumstances should you stay in this flea hole!! My colleagues and I, three young females, were due to stay here for 5 nights, lets just say we didn't stay for 5 minutes!! We were guarnteed a triple room and had 2 single beds and one piece of foam on the floor. Sheets were dirty, towels were dirty, walls were stained, no where to hang clothes, communal areas smelt damp. I had bites on my arms and my colleague had a bite on her leg. I am in the process of writing a scathing letter to trading standards to try and shut this hovel down. Enter at your own peril!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Blondie72
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel September 2007 for one night. it was booked as a spur of the moment decision and after reading previous reviews I was quite dubious regarding what the hotel would be like, also the fact that the taxi driver had never heard of the hotel made us even more wary! However, on arrival, although basic, the room was clean and quite spacious, altho smelt slightly foisty. Staff were pleasant and helpful giving directions etc. Not too far from St Paul's Cathedral. Breakfast was good - cereal, tea/coffee, toast, juice etc. This hotel was ok as a one off but I doubt I would stay here again, I would recommend staying in the covent garden area as this is much more lively and interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of the scary owner”
Reviews.Author: chippers_7
Reviews.Content: When you get a room in a London hotel for Â£42, you can't expect fantastic quality and awesome facilities. What you should be able to expect is politeness from staff, and maybe even a welcoming smile. Having taken my room key out of the hotel (apparently against the rules - not that i'd been told), I was the subject of a verbal tirade from London's equivalent of Basil Fawlty. The rooms are tiny, badly decorated and poorly equipped. It is however very convenient for Kings Cross station....

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: fragmented5
Reviews.Content: Website looks good but don't be fooled. The hotel looks nothing like their website. DUMP.

Reviews.Title: “A great disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: Terden
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a total disappointment. Their marketing staff have done a great job through their website. In reality - a very different story. There were 2 beds in a room that was meant to sleep only one. It was claustrophobic and the space so limited that we had to put our bags on top of each other if we still wanted to reach the bathroom. It was dirty like it has not been cleaned in weeks. The staff was unfriendly. You have to pay in full in advance and if you have a longer stay - you are bound to just pull through somehow. Will not go back there and will not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Alkenna
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel. The staff is absolutely dreadful and they do nothing to solve your problems that they created in the first place........

Reviews.Title: “preferred to be outside”
Reviews.Author: himandhim
Reviews.Content: Carpet was dirty, there were dead flies everywhere so i can only imagine the room hadn't been used for some time, can't tell whether the bed linen had been washed as it was old, the bed was made up though. Hair everywhere i'm also talking pubic as well. There was some attempt at cleaning the toilet though the cleaning fluid had dripped down the pan. The positives are :The room smelt okay, good breakfast although the juices were not rotated so best to take one from the front of the breakfast trolley . The views from windows interesting, can't imagine why anyone would want to live in a mess. Hotel not far from main shopping area, a map or walking sat nav neccessary.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but clean...”
Reviews.Author: spartacusuk
Reviews.Content: I visit this hotel quite regularly. It would be easier to get a hotel in a big corporate chain through my employers, but this costs them less, and actually I prefer it. The rooms have a modern appearance, and are very clean, and theres good tv reception (they seem to be moving over to digital, but possibly with the odd hitch.) It's quiet (ask for a room at the back for complete quiet!), convenient, staff are friendly, and breakfast, while not full english, is fine. On the downside, this isn't the place I'd take my girlfriend for a romantic weekend, and the corridors smell a bit. But then at these prices, I dont mind a few rough edges.

HotelInfo.Name: Swinton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 18-24 Swinton Street, London WC1X 9NX, England
